I switched from VPN to Tor and started seeding and in under a minute can now see the full resolution on all but the first three images in this post >>00b5bba9-7933-4740-838a-d1596c0a4c9a and am seeding. I'm guessing that ZeroNet is picky about who is seeding what on Tor. Not much of a problem on larger boards, but for smaller boards it's a pain.

>EDIT: Will come back tomorrow, need to get to work.
Damn it, anon comes here to relax, not troubleshoot!

And now I'm only connected to one peer while on Tor. Interesting. It seems VPNs are the way to go until the image issue gets sorted out.

>>5255a2c8-0204-4752-b407-b06bf4e32793
Essentially true. Any images you post on ZeroNet are linked to your identity address **you can find someone's IA by clicking the mute button on their post** which can be found in your ZeroNet folder. data.json contains the text of every post you've made while using that IA, and src contains every image you've posted while using that IA. There are ways to generate a new IA while keeping your blacklist of users/boards though, and unless you post personal information you're as safe from being doxed as if you were posting on 8chan. At most you can find out if the anon you're replying to visits /abdl/.

Ultimately though, that's not the issue of using ZeroNet. It's accidentally hosting illegal content. I'd use a VPN or Tor if you're trying to seed the site, and either running a VM or deleting the ZeroNet folder after you're done using the site if you just want to shitpost without seeding.

>And whats the easiest way of doing that?

>go to your (Your ZeroNet Folder)/core/plugins
>find folder "disabled-Multiuser"
>rename to "Multiuser"
Every time ZeroNet is restarted it will now generate a new identity address

Quickest way to restart ZeroNet
>click Homepage button top right corner
>click the three dots beside "Hello ZeroNet_"
>click last option in menu "Shut Down ZeroNet"
Connection will be cut, you'll be back online after a short wait.

>>fde286de-4437-46f8-94e0-a743211f9ab7
I'm not seeing an option to change plugins via that menu.

But yes, it's the same thing. Change plugin, restart ZeroNet when you want a new ID

I think I've finally figured out how pinning works. When a board is pinned, anytime you open a thread on that board it automatically starts seeding any file you can see see in that thread. This means if you want to seed images/pdfs/videos that are hidden because someone posted more than 5 files, you need to unhide them. Otherwise you'll only start seeding the visible files.

So it's not just enough to pin a board, if you want to seed the "optional files" there you need to visit periodically and lurk the threads.

Alright, I fucked around for a second and found out how to see if what you've posted is being seeded
>right-click image name, save link as
>copy whatever string it gives you
>click button top right, will take you to ZeroNet homepage
>go to files tab
>paste string into search tab
>file comes up with number of peers/amount of data uploaded
I tried it on drawfag's image and saw there are two people seeding, but the icons are filled in with orange instead of green. I'm assuming this means someone is trying to seed a file but there aren't any peers to leech the file from.

Honestly shouldn't be this much of a hassle to see if what you've posted is being shared.

There's a zeronet plugin that generates a new cert every time zeronet is started. It's included by default, but disabled.

posts.subject: Deus Ex
posts.body: What exactly makes Deus Ex such an intriguing game? What did it do differently that other games at that time didn't?

It featured a branching story, and was apparently well-researched rather than cobbled together out of bullshit news stories. The "RPG" elements of gaining stats and abilities lended themselves to expanding the gameplay options. You could tackle many objectives through various paths and methods, which made for a lot of replayability. Its only failing, if you can call it that, is that it's not really a fun romp, more of a story you work through.

It was a much more player-centric game than anything that came before. However you liked to play, it found a way to accommodate you.
It was, and remains to this day, the most intellectually ambitious first-person shooter made.
The music was really good most of the time

>>e5649c82-0639-4fb3-8301-76e4bda0da8c
>tfw talking about a cyberpunk game.
>tfw we cyberpunk terrorists now.

For me it was the story. Like >>a6353d89-21cb-4c8f-b21e-c26c2bf84de6 said the game was very well researched. The dialog in general, but specially with the chinese barman, the Illuminati AI and the dialog between FEMA soldiers discussing laws that let the government take over the media whenever they wanted showed that the writers had an idea of what they were talking about. Also the variety of ways you could handle problems is impressive, I still laugh whenever I think about how I just ran away with my augmented cyberlegs every time Simmons showed up.
The stealth is okay but gets broken later, and the VA is laughably bad though.

>>e5649c82-0639-4fb3-8301-76e4bda0da8c
Because it's /pol/: The Game. Yes, even the jews. Remember that the list for FEMA was 6 million Americans? Yeah, obvious parallelism there.
Other than that it had some cute features and things like the roombas and the branching stories but nobody would give a shit if it wasn't for the topics the game touches on (which would be completely off limits to a modern studio).
That said, the team that developed it is almost fully composed of jews. So it's just Talmudic disclosure probably.

posts.subject: Anon's bizarre vidya adventure AKA /v/ makes an RPG maker game: (New game plus edition) #013
posts.body:
==NOW WITH LESS HALFCHAN AND REDDITOR ENCOUNTERS==
Were creating a video game in RPG Maker VX Ace together with other anons.
Heres how it works.
Everyone is taking turns downloading the newest version of the game, making contributions before reuploading it for someone else to work on it. Only one person can actively work on it at a time. This is because if two people make overlapping changes to the database, scripts or switches, they will conflict resulting in one person having to redo all their work. Changes to the map and events can be copy-pasted from one version of a project to another so youre free to work on new maps and new events if its not your turn and add them to the current version of the game once it is your turn.
It should work like this. OP posts newest version of the map. The first person (Anon #1) to respond to OP stating that hes going to work on it becomes the active game dev. Once Anon #1 finishes and re-uploads it, the first person to respond to him gets to work on it. So on and so forth. Additionally, whenever you re-upload a new version, reply to the anchor post, itll make things a lot easier.
==GENERAL RULES==
>Dont mess with maps, events or anything else you didnt make. Although, adding minor stuff like a connection between two areas or fixing bugs and typos is all fine. 
>If youre ok with others editing your stuff, leave a note saying so.
>Youre free to add characters and the like, to the inter-dimensional tavern.
>Youre also free to make changes to game settings, unless its something weve agreed upon (well probably do this via a poll)
>We also have a dedicated board now >>>/bizarre/ come post and check it out! (The exact way we use, and the general purpose of the board in relation to the threads on /v/ will probably change change over time. However there will always be threads maintained on /v/, regardless of what happens on the board.)

==FAQ==
==How do I RPG Maker VX Ace?==
>Heres a good tutorial series if you want to learn how to use it. inb4 jewtube

posts.subject: Xeno games discussion
posts.body:
After playing Xenoblade Chronicles 1 and Xenoblade X, I wanted to go back and play the rest of the Xeno games. I started playing Xenogears and so far it seems quite interesting. Particularly I really dig the aesthetics, the combo system and the world building. The soundtrack is pretty good too. Combat seems a bit on the simple side, at least compared to Xenoblade, but it may just be that the game seems to have a "slow". I'm just after rescuing Marge, so I think it is too early still to judge the combat system. How does this game compares to Xenosaga and Xenoblade? How good/bad the combat system is? Is the writing good (despite being pretty much unfinished from what I heard)?

Also, looking forward to play also Xenosaga. How do they fare? I heard they had some development problems as well and later chapters suffer from it. How is Xenoblade 2? Opinions seem quite split for what I heard. Particularly, its the gameplay good compared to the other two games?

Xenosaga 1 is an almost impenetrably dense, painfully pretentious game that I still love simply because it's an interesting setting and **KOS-MOS makes my dick go doki-doki**. It's the kind of JRPG that has literal 20 minute long cutscenes and throws a metric fuckton of made-up terms and words at you. It was unique and extremely neat but dragged like nobody's business and I never ended up finishing it **which I deeply regret**. I never played Xenosaga 2 out of shame as a result.

Xenoblade Chronicles 2 is great and I love it. The characters are interesting, the combat is pretty not bad, and it's got that Xeno* quality where you slowly develop your character however you want and end up with a result that's pretty unique. It's got a lot of problems, not the least of which is the gachashit Blade drawing system, but I wholeheartedly recommend it anyway **Zeke is best character and Pandoria a cute**

xenoblade 2 is pretty fun when you slowly learn how to do combos and shit like that.
xenosaga has its ups and downs, but in 3 it has the best mech fights of the series.

>Xenosaga
When you get into the headspace it just works
>Xenoblade 2
Yeah, the gachashit would be an interesting idea but the characters fall very naturally into the the roles

>>c9111b6d-2ed6-4931-94d7-6ab830361aac
>the combat is pretty not bad

How does it compare to Xenoblade X particularly? I think despite some flaws, X's combat was pretty good, with quite a lot of freedom when developing your character and party, while each enemy had dangerous attacks that could wreck you and you could create builds to work around it. It is still as good as X, or at least Xenoblade 1?

>>d65cd0a0-d340-4601-bcac-7b21e74ab4bf
>xenosaga has its ups and downs, but in 3 it has the best mech fights of the series.

That sounds great, love the mecha fights in Xenogears, I'm looking forward to see them in Xenosaga.

Xenosaga I and III are solid. II suffers from middle-chapteritis though I liked its combat system best.

Have not played Xenoblade but nothing can top Xenogears for me. Especially its soundtrack.
So what's the proper order for playing the Xeno series in terms of canon?

I wish they made Xenoblade Chronicle X-2, but this time actually finished the game, polished the flaws of the first and introduced new interesting mechanics. X has to be one of the most satisfying modern open world RPGs right now, with a good combat system, with a lot of content and a world that is actually interesting to explore (specially when you find some of the hidden bosses and shit your pant's at the size of them). It just that the story was unfinished and clearly the game needed more work. I blame the multiplayer component for fucking with the development of the game. If at least you could roam the world in Coop it may have been cool, but the pseudo multiplayer elements and the coop missions were lame. I also would had liked more aliens as party members, seeing as the story focused so much in learning to live in a new planet and cohabit with other civilizations.

Finally, a little pit peeve of mine, but I wish we could allocate more skills on our "hotbars" so to speak, kind of like Sulk's Monado's Artes, the player have a set of Melee Skills and Ranged skills, and changing weapons mid fight would bring one or the other.

posts.subject: FFXIV General- A New Beginning Edition
posts.body:
==FFXIV: Shadowbringers General==


Try the game for free forever! (Only up to level 35) - http://www.ffxiv-freetrial.com/us/

==Current Patch: 5.05==
Patch Archives - http://na.finalfantasyxiv.com/lodestone/special/patchnote_log/

==Useful resources:==
List of Commands (used for macros) - http://na.finalfantasyxiv.com/lodestone/playguide/win/text_command/
Gamer Escape - http://ffxiv.gamerescape.com/
Garland Tools Database - http://www.garlandtools.org/db/
FF logs - http://www.fflogs.com/
ACT (but don't tell anyone you're using it) - http://advancedcombattracker.com/
FFXIV Guild (Leveling guides) - https://www.ffxivguild.com/
Teamcraft (crafting lists, rotation simulator, gathering alarms, etc.) - https://ffxivteamcraft.com/search
Ariyala (gear build simulator, hunt tracker, relic light tracker) - http://ffxiv.ariyala.com/

>Don't know what to do pre-80?
1. If you're brand new, do Hall of the Novice. It's stupid and only teaches you common sense stuff, but you get a 30% exp boosting ring and free level 15 gear.
2. Do all of your Main Story Quests - REQUIRED TO GET TO HEAVENSWARD AREAS/JOBS, HEAVENSWARD STORY IS REQUIRED FOR STORMBLOOD, etc. **though Stormblood/Shadowbringers jobs do not require story, just level 50/60**
3. Do all of your class quests and get yourself a job - http://ffxiv.gamerescape.com/wiki/Category:Jobs
4. Attune to Chocobo Porters, Aetherytes & Aether Currents ASAP - it will save you a lot of time & effort
5. Unlock your challenge log, gives great exp and some gil - http://ffxiv.gamerescape.com/wiki/Rising_to_the_Challenge
6. Do your daily roulettes - all of them are great until 80, except guildhests, which is great until around 40-50
7. Level crafting & gathering - free dosh (Cross-class skills make investing in multiple/all crafters worth it.)
8. Hit Tab to [I seem to have misplaced my keyboard]
9. Utilize the world-visit function to visit any world (server) on your datacenter. You can buy (but not sell) from their marketboards.

==Get a FC, they give bonuses as long as the people in charge aren't retards==
==You cannot join a FC if you are currently on a free trial account==
==There is a cross-world linkshell for all anons on Primal, which free trial accounts can join==
**The two "main" 8ch FCs are Old Wheels Order [OwO] on Exodus, and Infinity [INF] on Lamia**

Shitpost about cats, GCD, ACT, and how **Emet-Selch did nothing wrong.**

>>68d62c34-78a4-4f01-a833-12e5a1032a8d
So I need to use the bittorrent protocol and tor to post about FFXIV now? Someone committed an irrelevant crime in a town I've never even heard of, and the logical punishment is me not being able to post about FFXIV anymore? We really do deserve to be nuked, at this point.

>>9ec922bf-63a3-419a-8808-9f8167446c13
So is life. We live in a very lame cyberpunk future.

Now, back to FF XIV. What changes do you want for the jobs for 5.1? For my part, MNK's changes in 5.05 were good, but some of them may be a bit strong (Riddle of the Earth) while leaving SSS, Tornado Kick and Anatma practically useless, as now keeping your stacks is way easier. I'll say turning them into regular oGCD skills may be the solution, but I'll prefer if they had further function beside damage, even if it is not related to GL, but can't think of anything good. SMN is great for me, but is getting a lot of hate, I fear big changes are on the way. For my part, I'll like if SE fucking fixed the pet's AIs already so Bahamuth and Phoenix prioritize attacking before moving so we stop losing so much DPS. Also wouldn't mind if Ruin II was a bit stronger and the timing of Tri-disaster wasn't as awkward, it feels pretty bad to enter trance when Tri is like less than 15 seconds away from coming out of cooldown, or having to manually apply DoTs when there are less than 10 seconds for Wyrm Trance. For SCH, I wish they gave us back some more skills. At this point I have given up in them coming with interesting downtime for SCH, so at least SB damage rotation should do.

Edit: oh, also, would like if SMN's potencies were increased. Their damage feels too low for what is supposed to be a core element of the class. Egi Action being only Ruin IV generators bothers me, I like the interaction between Egi and summoner, but I'll like them being more important. Also wouldn't mind them being turned into Demi with a buff to their attacks, but that is too much to ask.

>>9ec922bf-63a3-419a-8808-9f8167446c13
At least this weird bittorrent protocol doesn't have Faceberg, Twitter, Jewgle, etc. At the end of the day, it may be really a feature.

>>e8d233d55518
I feel you about SMN stuff. In SB a lot of the skills keyed into each other and made their sort of a process to it all but with ShB a lot of stuff are independent of each other and makes you have to watch a lot of different cooldowns for optimal dps.

I'm not 80 yet with my character so I don't know how it pans out in endgame but I was disappointed over what the 70+ skills/traits you get as a SMN.

PLD though seems pretty fine. In fact I'm surprised how decent the damage has been for it with atonement and holy circle.
